> [{quoted}](name=TheMoonlitShadow,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j5OA2Vyx,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-02-06T20:52:30.569+0000)
>
> Melees don't have a consistent base MR... do they?

Actually they do. All champions in the game have either 30 base MR with no MR/level (mostly ranged champions) or about 32 MR at level 1 with a little more MR every level (mostly melee champions) capping at about 53 MR at level 18. There are, however, two exceptions to this pattern in the game:

* Ivern has 30 base MR at level 1 but still gets scaling MR per level, ending up with about 51 MR at level 18.

* Katarina starts with about 34 MR at level 1 and gets scaling MR per level up to 55 at level 18.

It does seem strange to have exactly two champions break the pattern, and in a way that looks like it was a mistake with the base level 1 values as opposed to some actual unique scaling meant for them.

Ivern it kinda makes sense, he's a really funky champ and nothing about him really fits a champion norm. Katarina is kinda random, and is so exact in being two above everyone else that I think it's an overlook.

From the wiki
Magic Resistance (or MR) is a stat that all units have, including minions, monsters, and buildings. Increasing magic resistance reduces the magic damage the unit takes. Each champion begins with some magic resistance which may increase with level. You can gain additional magic resistance from abilities, items, masteries, and runes. Magic resistance stacks additively.

All champions begin with 30 or 32.1 base magic resistance with the exception of Maokai and Katarina. Currently no ranged champion gains magic resistance per level, but most melee champions do except Kassadin and Yasuo.

Elise, Gnar,  Jayce, Kayle and Nidalee do not gain magic resistance per level because they are not always melee champions due to their variable attack range.

All champions that do gain magic resistance per level gain 1.25 magic resistance per level, reaching 53.4 base magic resistance at level 18.

That section seems to need an update as Maokai currently has 32 MR at level 1 with scaling MR in line with the other "high MR" champions. There was a time when he had 30 base MR with no scaling MR like all "low MR" champions but I don't think he has ever had a unique base MR (or if he did it was a very long time ago).
There are a few pages on the wikia that are rarely updated. Stats like MR or AD rarely get updated, because it's a pain to update everything whenever changes happen.
